alert.note: Alert for Itasca (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 5:52PM CDT until August 16 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Minnesota, including the following county, Itasca, including the cities of Grand Rapids and Coleraine. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 550 PM CDT, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of up to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Grand Rapids, Cohasset, Coleraine, Swan River, Taconite, Warba, Gunn, Pokegama Dam, Pokegama Lake, Trout Lake Near Bovey, Blackberry, Bovey, Marble, La Prairie, Hart Lake, Goodland, Calumet, Swan Lake, Wawina and Hill Annex Mine State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
